data.title: Atom does not start. Ubuntu 14.04, Atom 0.166
data.body:
I am unable to start Atom after update to release 0.166.
I receive this error:

```
/opt/atom/atom: error while loading shared libraries: libgconf-2.so.4: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```

The library libgconf-2.so.4 is installed and it is under:

```
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgconf-2.so.4
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgconf-2.so.4.1.5
```

Thanks

data.title: Dev-linked default-installed package's stylesheets not loaded
data.body:
I'm taking a look at bracket-matcher due to #4868 and I'm trying to test changes I'm making to the stylesheet, but when I:
1. `apm link` (whether `--dev` or not) the bracket-matcher package
2. Start Atom in the appropriate mode

The stylesheet for the bracket-matcher package isn't loaded:

![screen shot 2015-01-06 at 8 03 07 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1038121/5631319/7e0d47fa-957a-11e4-907d-06fbef25a80e.png)

Isn't here either:

![screen shot 2015-01-06 at 8 03 45 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1038121/5631329/93320724-957a-11e4-9f0e-33750c193552.png)

This is with the Shadow DOM enabled.

If I unlink the bracket-matcher package and restart Atom, everything works as expected:

![screen shot 2015-01-06 at 8 05 13 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1038121/5631357/c6106b5e-957a-11e4-8a04-b8dcf6c42f9f.png)

Atom v0.167.0-a9c0553 on Mac OS X 10.10.1

/cc @nathansobo

data.title: The new Shadow DOM by default removes opening and closing tags element indicators
data.body:
I have tested this both on a Windows 8.1 x64 and a Mac OS Yosemite.
The HTML tags no longer show related opening and closing tags. If I disable the Shadow DOM option and reload Atom they show again.
The same thing happens in JS files with, for example, functions: no underlined is shown on the { and } tags.

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1943233/5630252/f76b1878-95b3-11e4-9249-4380c98dfcb3.gif)

data.title: New dependancies
data.body:
Seems that a new release or patch for Atom (my system is showing "0.165.0" now) appeared either yesterday or this morning (Jan 5 or 6)?  My package management system notified me of the update this morning.  After installing the update, I could not get Atom to load on my Xubuntu 14.10 64-bit system, getting a series of dependency errors:

/opt/atom/atom: error while loading shared libraries: blahblahblah: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

Executing the following command apparently loaded the 32-bit versions of these libraries, which got me working again:

apt-get install libgconf2-4:i386 libnss3:i386 libxtst6:i386 libcap2:i386

data.title: HELP/QUESTION: "Frame" to preview SPA
data.body: Is it possible to embed a "frame" next to the text editor area that acts as a preview for CSS/HTML being written?  I don't really know where to even look to get started.  Thanks

data.title: Install atom on specific location in windows
data.body:
I am not sure if solution to this is already exists or not.

Lets say, I want to install atom on custom location like C:/apps/atom - Current installer doesn't provide something like this.

I know, we can do this using zip version but in this case we will not able to add atom editor ('Open with atom') in windows context menu.

Please advice if this feature is already added.

data.title: :memo: Prevent confusion over project.contains
data.body:
See https://discuss.atom.io/t/testing-for-the-existence-of-a-file/14079

Perhaps this is overkill, but I wanted to prevent future confusion regarding this function. Got some of the language from node-pathwatcher.

data.title: hyperlink
data.body: is there a way to open hyperlinks from the editor at all? or is someone able to make this happen?

data.title: Double-click (and triple-click) selection, followed by shift+left/up arrows to expand or shrink selection, assumes rightward or downward change
data.body:
To match behavior of browsers and other editors the assumption should be to expand the selection in the direction pressed, i.e.

Double-click a word. Press shift + left.
- Expected behavior: Selection expands one character to the left.
- Actual behavior: Selection diminishes by one character from the right.

Double-click a word. Press shift + up.
- Expected behavior: Selection expands one line up with the resulting left-most character in new selection vertically aligned with the left of the originally selected word.
- Actual behavior: Original selection is lost, new selection starts at the character preceding the original selected word, left-most character aligns vertically with last letter of the previous selection.

There are similar issues when throwing in the Command key to expand selections to beginning of lines and beginning or pages.

data.title: "Uncaught TypeError: Unable to watch path" Windows / Linux samba share
data.body:
I run into this issue repeatedly. I know there are already a bunch of reports about this error message, but it's hard to tell what are duplicates because of all the variations. When I get this now it's paired with a second error:

```
Uncaught TypeError: Unable to watch path
Uncaught ReferenceError: spawnSync is not defined
```

(See bottom for detailed version.)

The details about my situation:

Atom (currently 0.153.0), no packages installed, running on Windows 7 x64.

Atom will run fine for some amount of time, then I try to open a file and get this error. It doesn't seem to be related to renaming files, as in some of the other reports. At least sometimes I can still open a file in a different window. At least sometimes I can open a file in the same window with a different path. For example, I'm often loading files from a samba share running on Ubuntu 12, e.g.

`\\server\share\somedir\somefile`

When the problem strikes I don't seem to be able to load any more files from `\\server\share\somedir` in the same window. But if I map a drive to the same share, I seem to be able to load files from there, e.g.:

`Z:\somedir\somefile`

I've already tried setting `fs.inotify.max_user_watches` to `32768` (on the Ubuntu system) as suggested in #2082 and the problem persists.

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of null
data.body:
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of null

**Atom Version**: 0.154.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.1
**Thrown From**: [status-wordcount](https://github.com/segphault/status-wordcount) package
### Steps To Reproduce
1. Create document with contents. Mine was a markdown document.
2. Toggle status-wordcount package.
3. Enter more content in document
4. Ctrl-N to create a new document.
5. Click on new document's tab.
6. Error occurs.

Error continues to occur when status-wordcount package is toggled off.
